subject: Discrimination
lead_paragraph: A former athletic manager for Hofstra University’s football team said in a federal discrimination lawsuit that players sexually harassed her repeatedly, including when an assistant played a sexually explicit film on a team bus. Lauren Summa, a 23-year-old graduate student, said that her complaints to coaches and university officials went unheeded, and that she was dropped from the team’s athletic staff after speaking out. Hofstra’s vice president for university relations, Melissa Connolly, said in a statement the college was “confident that all matters relating to these allegations were handled appropriately.”.
